intro: Tapinanthus pungu, commonly known as the parasitic orchid, is a hemiparasitic plant that derives some of its nutrients from its host. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is native to sub-Saharan Africa. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its yellowish-green stems and small, showy flowers. It typically grows on the roots of other plants, such as trees and shrubs, and can cause significant damage to its host. Due to its parasitic nature, it plays a unique role in the ecological dynamics of its environment.
